sense.name: a person who is aggressively pursued, chased
sense.examples: The handsome wealthy bachelor became the quarry of several single women at our firm. The security police crossed the border in pursuit of their quarry, a known terrorist.

sense.name: an open excavation site for mining stone
sense.examples: The children like to swim in the deep water of the old quarry at the edge of town. The sculptor gets his best marbles from a quarry in northern Italy.

sense.name: an animal that is hunted as prey
sense.examples: A lion will track its quarry for miles. The rabbits and field mice are quarry for the local foxes.

sense.name: a diamond-shaped windowpane
sense.examples: The little cottage had lattice windows with quarries.

sense.name: an unglazed floor tile
sense.examples: Mary looked at many samples of quarry at the tile store.
